name: Anne Tyler, Today's Jane Austen Quiz | Literature | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which Tyler book doesn't have a female protagonist?
questions.explanation:
Saint Maybe.

	Ian Bedloe is the main character in "Saint Maybe."

questions.text: In "Back When We Were Grown-ups," what is Rebecca's main problem?
questions.explanation:
identity crisis.

	Rebecca isn't sure she has turned out to be the person she was originally destined to be.

questions.text: In "Ladder of Years," how does Delia meet Adrian Bly-Brice?
questions.correct: Both are shopping in a supermarket.
options: He owns a cafe and she's a customer.
questions.explanation:
Both are shopping in a supermarket.

	Delia's husband calls Adrian "Adrian Fried-Rice."

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT the name of a business in an Anne Tyler novel?
questions.explanation:
The Voluptuous Woman.

	Other great AT invented names include Rent-a-Back, The Clutter Counselor and "The Gray Gourmet" (Biddy's book title).

questions.text: Which AT character most closely resembles Maggie's husband Ira?
questions.explanation:
Dr. Sam Grinstead

	Both Maggie's and Delia's husbands are fairly steady, sensible men who love their wives but think they are flighty or ditzy.

questions.text: In "A Patchwork Planet," what is Barnaby's main problem?
questions.correct: He's afraid people won't think he's trustworthy.
options: He thinks he's responsible for his brother's death.
His beloved brother is the family black sheep.
questions.explanation:
He's afraid people won't think he's trustworthy.

	As a teenager, Barnaby robbed houses. He's also a divorced dad who doesn't see his daughter very often.

questions.text: Where are most Anne Tyler novels set?
questions.correct: Baltimore & Baltimore, MD & Baltimore, Maryland & Baltimore Maryland & Baltimore MD
questions.explanation:
Baltimore & Baltimore, MD & Baltimore, Maryland & Baltimore Maryland & Baltimore MD.

	Anne Tyler lives in Baltimore, too, though she did not grow up there.

Pulitzer.

	In my opinion, "Saint Maybe" was just as good.

questions.text: In "Back When We Were Grown-ups," what is Rebecca's natural daughter's name?
questions.explanation:
Min Foo.

	The book says Min Foo looked Asian when she was born, though she isn't. She and her half-sisters (Rebecca's step-daughters) all have straight, thick, black hair.

questions.text: What happens at the end of "Back When We Were Grown-ups"?
questions.correct: Rebecca feels glad she turned out as she did.
options: Rebecca throws a birthday party for herself.
questions.explanation:
Rebecca feels glad she turned out as she did.

	I hope Rebecca will marry Zeb, but who knows?
